category.name: Networking/Security
category.description: Configure addressing, delivery and security options

setting.name: Modem VID
setting.description: Set/read radio modem Vendor Identification Number (VID). Only radio modems with matching VIDs can communicate with each other.

setting.name: Hopping Channel
setting.description: Set/read spread spectrum channel on which modem communicates. Separate channels minimize interference between multiple sets of modems operating in the same vicinity.

setting.name: Destination Address
setting.description: Set/read module's destination address.

setting.name: Source Address
setting.description: Set/read module's source address. If set to 0xFFFF, then the DT address is used for both source and destination addresses.

setting.name: Address Mask
setting.description: Set/read the module address mask for configuration of local and global address spaces.

setting.name: Retries
setting.description: Set/read maximum number of RF packet delivery attempts. If RR is non-zero and MT is zero, packets sent from the radio will request an acknowledgement, and can be resent up to RR times if no acknowledgements are received.

setting.name: Multiple-Transmit
setting.description: Set/read number or retransmissions. If MT parameter is a non-zero value, RR is ignored and all packets are sent MT+1 times, without any delay between the transmissions.

setting.name: Delay Slots
setting.description: Set/read the maximum number of delay slots used for random back-off algorithm after transmission failure. A delay slot is 5 msec @ BR=1 and 54 msec @ BR=0.

setting.name: Streaming Limit
setting.description: Set/read maximum number of continuous bytes transmitted by one module before forcing a delay that allow other modules to transmit. 0 = disabled.

setting.name: AES Encryption Key
setting.description: Set/read AES encryption settings. Set 256-bit key (64 hex digits) on multiple radios for encrypted RF communication. Set to '0' to disable encryption. Reading parameter returns a '0' (encryption disabled) or '1' (enabled). The key cannot be read for security reasons.

category.name: Serial Interfacing
category.description: Configure serial (UART) interface and I/O line options

setting.name: Baud Rate
setting.description: Select serial interface rate (speed for data transfer between radio modem and host). Serial data rate does not have to match the RF data rate which is adjustable using the BR command. If the serial data rate is set higher than the RF data rate, CTS may need to be observed to prevent DI buffer overrun.

setting.name: Parity
setting.description: Select parity settings for UART communications.

setting.name: Stop Bits
setting.description: Select number of stop bits used for UART communications.

setting.name: Packetization Timeout
setting.description: RF transmission begins after receiving RB bytes, or after receiving at least 1 byte and seeing RO character times of silence on the UART. If RO=0, then RB bytes must be received before beginning transmission.

setting.name: Maximum RF Packet Size
setting.description: Set/read maximum RF packet size. Must be 256 (0x100) or less for 9600 baud RF rate (BR=0), and 2048 (0x800) or less for 115200 baud RF rate (BR=1).

setting.name: Pin 9 Configuration
setting.description: Select behavior of Pin 9 of XTend Module, CTS on DB9).

setting.name: Pin 10 Configuration
setting.description: Select function for Pin 10 of XTend Module, RTS on DB9).

setting.name: Pin 3 Configuration
setting.description: Select behavior of Pin 3 of XTend module, DCD & DSR on DB9).

setting.name: Software Flow Control
setting.description: Select flow control options. Enables software flow control (XON/XOFF) between radio modem and host.

setting.name: Flow Control Threshold
setting.description: Set/read the flow control threshold. De-assert CTS and/or send XOFF when FT bytes are in the UART receive buffer.

category.name: RF Interfacing
category.description: Configure RF power level, RF data rate, etc.

setting.name: RF Data Rate
setting.description: Select RF data rate (over-the-air transmission rate).

setting.name: TX Power Level
setting.description: Select transmit power level. Note that modem requires 5 VDC supply (or greater) for full 1 Watt output power. If supply voltage is less than 5V, the radio will transmit at the highest power level possible and set a warning flag.

setting.name: Transmit Only
setting.description: Select TX/RX or TX Only.

setting.name: Forced Sync Time
setting.description: Set/read forced re-sync period. Normally only the first packet of a transmission event contains the sync preamble. This command allows forced periodic sync preambles during long transmission events. Zero disables this feature.

category.name: Diagnostics
category.description: Commands used for displaying modem status information

setting.name: Firmware Version
setting.description: Read module firmware version number

setting.name: Hardware Version
setting.description: Read module hardware version number

setting.name: Serial Number High
setting.description: Read high 16 bits of 32 bit unique serial number

setting.name: Serial Number Low
setting.description: Read low 16 bits of 32 bit unique serial number

setting.name: RSSI PWM Timer
setting.description: Set/read duration of PWM (pulse width modulated) output on pin 11. The PWM output encodes fade margin (RX signal strength relative to RX sensitivity) by varying the duty cycle of a 125Hz square wave.

setting.name: Board Temperature
setting.description: Read current temperature of module in degrees Celsius (8-bit twos-complement, eg. 26C = 0x1A, -10C = 0xF6).

setting.name: Board Voltage
setting.description: Read supply voltage to module (VCC) multiplied by 65536 (eg. 5.02V = 5.02*65536 = 0x5051F, maximum of 5 digits returned).

setting.name: Received Signal Strength
setting.description: Read signal level of last good packet received (RSSI) in dB (reports absolute value, eg. -88dBm = 0x58, accurate between -40 dBm to RX sensitivity).

setting.name: Receive Error Count
setting.description: Set/read number of RF Packets rejected because of bit errors in packet.

setting.name: Receive Good Count
setting.description: Set/read number of RF Packets successfully received.

setting.name: Delivery Failure Count
setting.description: Read number of RF packets sent where retries expire with no ACK received (when RR>0)

category.name: Sleep (Low Power)
category.description: Configure module to conserve energy using Sleep Modes

setting.name: Sleep Mode
setting.description: Select Sleep Mode option. Lowest power is achieved using the SHDN signal (pin 7 of XTend module). Cyclic sleep can be used to trade idle current consumption for transmission latency.

setting.name: Time before Sleep
setting.description: Set/read time period of inactivity (no serial or RF data is sent or received) before activating Sleep Mode - Only valid with Cyclic and Serial Port Sleep settings.

setting.name: Time before Wake-up Initializer
setting.description: Set/read time of inactivity (no serial or RF data is sent or received) before a Wake-up Initializer is sent. HT should be set shorter than ST of all remote radios.

setting.name: Wake-up Initializer Timer
setting.description: Set/read time of the Wake-up Initializer used to wake remote radios that are in cyclic sleep mode. Time of Wake-up Initializer should be longer than that of the remotes radio's cyclic sleep cycle (SM 4-8).

setting.name: Pin Wake-Up
setting.description: Select pin wake-up options. When PW=1, pin wake-up from Cyclic Sleep Mode is enabled.

setting.name: Guard Time Before
setting.description: Set/read required DI pin silent time before the Command Sequence Characters of the Command Mode Sequence (BT+CC_AT). The DI silent time is used to prevent inadvertent entrance into Command Mode.

setting.name: Command Sequence Character
setting.description: Set/read ASCII character to be used between Guard Times of the AT Command Mode Sequence (BT+CC+AT). The AT Command Mode Sequence causes the radio modem to enter Command Mode (from Idle Mode).

setting.name: Guard Time After
setting.description: Set/read required DI pin silent time after the Command Sequence Characters of the AT Command Mode Sequence (BT+CC+AT). The DI silent time is used to prevent inadvertent entrance into Command Mode.

setting.name: Command Mode Timeout
setting.description: Set/read time period of inactivity (no valid commands received) after which the radio modem automatically exits from Command Mode and returns to Idle Mode.
